Event.name: Transition_to_state
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> ends up in a <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_situation</fen>, or <fen>Final_quality</fen> which it was not in before. Some members of the frame (e.g. <m>grow.v</m>) tend to emphasize a gradual change, while most members of the frame do not indicate whether a change is gradual or not.
<ex><fex name="Explanation">Why</fex> <fex name="Entity">I</fex> <t>became</t> <fex name="Final_category">an Emacs user</fex></ex>
<ex><fex name="ent">I</fex> left the ministry and <t>became</t> <fex name="Final_category">an atheist</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Surprisingly, <fex name="Entity">various veteran organizations</fex> also <t>turned</t> <fex name="Final_quality">vehemently antiwar</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Transitional_period">Over the years</fex> <fex name="ent">she</fex> <t>grew</t> <fex name="Final_situation">to hate him</fex>.</ex>
This frame should be compared to Undergoing_change. Undergoing_change is different in that it much more emphasizes the difference between the pre- and post-states of the <fen>Entity</fen>. This shows up both in Undergoing_change's increased occurrence with <fen>Initial_category</fen> and <fen>Initial_state</fen> (<m>change from red to blue</m>) and in its increased occurrence with <fen>Final_category</fen> (<m>changed into a toad</m>) rather than <fen>Final_situation</fen> or <fen>Final_quality</fen> (<m>?changed to red</m> vs. <m>became/turned red</m>). In addition, when Undergoing_change occurs with the <fen>Final_category</fen> frame element, it presents a deep difference between the <fen>Initial_category</fen> and the <fen>Final_category</fen>, so that it is humorous to say 'she turned into a Republican', because it presents this as a fundamental change of identity; compare to 'she became a Republican', which is quite normal. In a less humorous example, someone can 'turn into a Mac user', strongly implying that they no longer use their former operating system, while if they 'become a Mac user', this is either as a replacement of other OS's or potentially as an addition to the use of other OS's.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When the change occurs.
<ex><fex name="tim">By 1945</fex> he had <t>become</t> uncertain of the advisability of anyone having such a weapon.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Duration_of_final_state
Arg.definition:
<def-root>For how long the <fen>Entity</fen> remains in the <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_situation</fen>, or <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
<ex>He <t>became</t> <fex name="dur">for the next three years</fex> the prophetic voice of the Salvadoran people until his assassination on March 24, 1980</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In cases where the <fen>Entity</fen> is intentional, <fen>Manner</fen> may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional <fen>Entity</fen> that also affect the event (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>The majority <fex name="man">slowly</fex> <t>became</t> more and more disenchanted with him.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> which undergoes a change, ending up in the <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_situation</fen>, or <fen>Final_quality</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ent">I</fex> <t>grow</t> impatient with your insolence.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_quality
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The quality of the <fen>Entity</fen> after the change.
<ex>Everything 's <t>going</t> <fex name="finq">wrong</fex>!</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_category
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> ends up in after the change.
<ex>He never could understand how she <t>ended</t> <t>up</t> <fex name="finc">an evangelist</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Transitional_period
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The period during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in transition.
<ex><fex name="trp">Over the last 5 years</fex>, I've <t>become</t> sick and tired of your tomfoolery.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_state
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the state of the <fen>Entity</fen> before becoming occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE marks the set of conditions under which the <fen>Entity</fen> enters the <fen>Final_category</fen>, <fen>Final_situation</fen>, or <fen>Final_quality</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Initial_category
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the category of the <fen>Entity</fen> before becoming occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Group
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual entities related to the <fen>Entity</fen> which are saliently affected by its change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any eventuality or entity which brings about the change of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Smithers <t>became</t> tired <fex name="Explanation">from all the work he'd been doing</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_situation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation after the change.
<ex>My father <t>got</t> <fex name="Final_situation">to where he did in the business</fex> through instinct and entrepreneurialism.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: get.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come into a specified state

lexUnit.name: end up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become (as the result of a process).
